If address(0), the native coin is used instead","_tokenId":"id of the token in the collection"}},"createOrder(address,uint256,uint256,uint256,address)":{"details":"before calling this function, the seller must call the nft.setApprovalForAll function by allowing the marketplace to operate","params":{"_amount":"amount of copies to sell","_collection":"address of the NFT smart contract. It must be deployed be the factory","_paymentToken":"address of the payment token you want to receive. Use address(0) for the native coin","_price":"total price for the order","_tokenId":"id of the NFT to sell"}},"endAuction(uint256)":{"params":{"_auctionId":"id of the auction"}},"getOrders(uint256,uint256,address)":{"params":{"_end":"ending index (exclusive)","_owner":"eventual filter of the orders. If it is equal to address(0), returns all orders","_start":"starting index (inclusive)"}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"setMarketPlaceFee(uint256)":{"params":{"_newMPFeesPercentage":"new marketplace fees percentage (scaled by 10^6)"}},"setNFTFactory(address)":{"params":{"_newFactory":"address of the new factory"}},"setNewTreasury(address)":{"params":{"_newMPFeesCollector":"new treasury address"}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See {IERC165-supportsInterface}."}},"version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"bid(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"create a bid for an auction"},"buy(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"buy (fully or partially) tokens from an order"},"cancel(uint256)":{"notice":"cancel an order by returning the tokens to the seller."},"constructor":{"notice":"Initializer"},"createAuction(address,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256,address)":{"notice":"create a new auction"},"createOrder(address,uint256,uint256,uint256,address)":{"notice":"create a sell order"},"endAuction(uint256)":{"notice":"end an auction. If it is successful, it processes the payments and transfers the NFT to the highest bidder. params._amount: if the auction uses an ERC20 token for payments, this is the amount of the bid in that token. If the auction uses the native coin, this parameter is not used.
params._auctionId: id of the auction to bid

params._id: id of the order to cancel.

params._collection: address of the NFT collection. It must be deployed by the NFT factory
params._paymentToken: address of the ERC20 token that the seller wants to receive.  If address(0), the native coin is used instead
params._tokenId: id of the token in the collection

createOrder(address,uint256,uint256,uint.details: before calling this function, the seller must call the nft.setApprovalForAll function by allowing the marketplace to operate

params._collection: address of the NFT smart contract. It must be deployed be the factory
params._paymentToken: address of the payment token you want to receive. Use address(0) for the native coin
params._tokenId: id of the NFT to sell

params._owner: eventual filter of the orders. If it is equal to address(0), returns all orders

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

bid(uint256,uint256).notice: create a bid for an auction

buy(uint256,uint256).notice: buy (fully or partially) tokens from an order

cancel(uint256).notice: cancel an order by returning the tokens to the seller.

endAuction(uint256).notice: end an auction. If it is successful, it processes the payments and transfers the NFT to the highest bidder. If it is unsuccessful, it returns the token to seller.

getOrders(uint256,uint256,address).notice: return the orders based on the provided indices

setMarketPlaceFee(uint256).notice: set a new marketplace fees (scaled by 1000000)

setNFTFactory(address).notice: update the address of the nft factory

setNewTreasury(address).notice: set a new address to collect marketplace fees
